I've done this once and only once, I felt so bad about it but I actually had another job to go to. I was doing day labouring and was told it would be a 9-5 job, it was going to go well until 9 that night when I was supposed to be working... I had to find some excuse to leave without appearing sick... But yeah, never doing that again
You'll have to let me know how it is... New Zealand is on my travel agenda for the end of next year.
That sucks. Hope you feel better soon!
Enjoy. Work? or just taking a vaca?
Yeah man. Dude seems pissed. Fuck trying to touch it. Those claws will fuck you up
Listened to the leak because I've got the album on order, pretty great!
Interestingly enough I saw the Used in 2006 when I was 16 and not once did they talk to the crowd, they just came out, did their set and didn't even utter another word. It was weird.
Saw a guy in a wheelchair just whip it out on Elizabeth street once... This was when I was 16 and just visiting Melbourne one weekend before I moved here, it's a miracle I still did I reckon
I wish I could go too... Oh well

Unfortunately for me I will be on tour so she's going on her own, but she'll have a good time!

2017 is going to be a huge year, I can feel it, part of me just wants it to hurry up and get here!

WRITING.TITLE: [QUESTION] Diamond Amplification
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey dudes and dudettes.
Looking at getting my first valve amp in years and I'm leaning very heavily towards a Diamond Spitfire II.
This is an amp I've had my eye on for a while since I found out that Jade from AFI uses them. I love his tones so it's something that I'm 100% interested in checking out.
There's only one dealer in Melbourne, Australia and only one of these in stock at a cool $2800. So this is an Amp I'm planning on having forever and gigging with for many, many years to come.
So why the post? Well. Does anyone else here use Diamond? What are your thoughts as far as longevity goes, are you happy with the tones and how versatile are they really?
Cheers.

WRITING.TITLE: DAE Randomly drop the Google "Street View" pin in the middle of a country just to look at that part of the world?
Reddit. Like MLK Jr... You have a dream! What is it?
Bit a Goon, Bit a Footy and a Bit a Punk Rock for ya.
[GEAR] NGD. My first flying V
WRITING.TEXT:
Growing up I went from a standard shape strat copy straight into an epiphone explorer and hated it. I wasnt ready to make the change with all them points.
So i sold it and got an epi SG. Since then ive aquired a tele and a les paul copy. But ive always been keen on giving a V a go.
Not just for experimental purposes but the idea of easily reaching the upper frets has always been interesting to me.
So I was browsing eBay the other day and caved. I got an LTD V-50 . One of the lower end of the LTD Models but it doesn't phase me for my first V. Havent plugged it in yet but had a bit of a fuckaround at work and loving the accessibility. Cant wait to get my strap installed and give it a proper standup go.
Here she is posing next to a train. Cos why the hell not
http://imgur.com/S3LocPR

Metallica's new studio album: Hardwired... To Self-Destruct - Official Reddit Discussion Thread
WRITING.TEXT:
Please see the [Official Band Release](https://metallica.com/blog/news/429181/hardwired-to-self-destruct-available-november-18-2) below
[Link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uhBHL3v4d3I) to the new single "Hardwired"
[Link](http://assets.blabbermouth.net.s3.amazonaws.com/media/metallicahardwiredcd.jpeg) to the album art
-------------------------------------- It really does exist! We know its been a long time coming, but today we proudly introduce you to HardwiredTo Self-Destruct, the long awaited next Metallica studio album that is the follow-up to Death Magnetic! Two discs, nearly 80 minutes of music is coming your way on November 18, 2016... yes, THIS YEAR! Hardwired represents the next phase of our journey as Metallica and we are so excited to share it with you. If anyone was tuned into radio station 93X in Minneapolis earlier today, you heard the world debut of the first track, Hardwired and were hoping youll hear a lot more of it in the coming days. Produced by Greg Fidelman, along with James and Lars, this is our 11th studio album and is available for pre-order in a variety of configurations including 12 songs on a double CD, vinyl, digital download, as well as a deluxe version with the riffs that were the origins of the album. Everyone who pre-orders the album through Metallica.com will receive an instant download of the song Hardwired. Keep watching this space for more information, we cannot wait to hit the road to play these songs live and get in your faces once again, so strap yourselves in INCOMING!
*Tracklist*
**Disc One**
-Hardwired (3:09)
-Atlas, Rise! (6:28)
-Now That Were Dead (6:59)
-Moth Into Flame (5:50)
-Dream No More (6:29)
-Halo On Fire (8:15)
**Disc Two**
-Confusion (6:41)
-ManUNkind (6:35)
-Here Comes Revenge {7:17)
-Am I Savage? (6:29)
-Murder One (5:45)
-Spit Out The Bone (7:09)
**Disc Three (Deluxe Edition Only)**
-Lords of Summer (2016)
-Ronnie Rising Medley
-When a Blind Man Cries
-Remember Tomorrow
-Helpless (Live at Rasputin Music)
-Hit the Lights (Live at Rasputin Music)
-The Four Horsemen (Live at Rasputin Music)
-Ride the Lightning (Live at Rasputin Music)
-Fade to Black (Live at Rasputin Music)
-Jump in the Fire (Live at Rasputin Music)
-For Whom the Bell Tolls (Live at Rasputin Music)
-Creeping Death (Live at Rasputin Music)
-Metal Militia (Live at Rasputin Music)
-Hardwired (Live in Minneapolis)

WRITING.TITLE: Matchbox Twenty - Long Day [Alt. Rock]
Question: We've been approached to have our music in a feature film.
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey guys, so a bit of a question, we're a small independent punk outfit from Melbourne, Australia. We've been asked if our music can be used in a small independent film.
Simple enough really. Except with films it's hard to tell whether or not they're going to be super successful or not.
Should we be working out some kind of deal with the film makers to have our film on the soundtrack as far as money is concerned?
We're not too phased about it at the moment but if in the long run the film does well, I can imagine we'll be kicking ourselves.

WRITING.TITLE: New Release ---- Clowns - Destroy The Evidence [Melbourne, Australia]
What is the most obvious thing you had to Google the answer for?
Field Runners
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey guys and girls. Bit of an obscure question about when the field runners started appearing in the AFL/VFL
People running drinks out to the players or coaching directions etc.
If it was pre-2000, what kind of things were they wearing. As far as I know, the pink highlights on their uniforms and stuff only came into effect recently and I can't really remember what they used to look like or if they were there at all.
The reason I ask is that we're filming a music video and want to have a runner, but it's 80s themed and I don't even know if they existed.
Cheers

A man finds a ladder, seemingly disappearing into the sky... [NSFW]-ish
WRITING.TEXT:
He begins to climb, getting higher and higher not knowing where the ladder will go. He passes by a very average looking woman, who says "Keep on climbing to success" and he figures "Why not?"
He keeps climbing and reaches another woman, this time far more attractive than the first, she says "Keep on climbing the ladder to success", so he does.
Next he reaches a stunning woman, 10/10, who says seductively, "Keep climbing the ladder to success", excitedly, he begins rushing until he reaches the top where lying on top of a platform is an old, nude man.
He then proclaims "Who the hell are you?" and the man replies "I'm Cess".
---- This was one of the first adult jokes I heard when I was younger.

WRITING.TITLE: Goon Bag Battle! - Punk Music Video from Melbourne
Have you ever seen a Goon Sack used as a weapon? -- New Music Video out of Melbourne
My hostel has bed bugs
WRITING.TEXT:
So its 4:34 a.m. and I'm currently sitting outside of my dorm room at my hostel because I've just killed 3 bed bugs and will be fucked if im going back in that bed. Its freezing in Sydney :(
I just tried to warn my friends who I am staying with and they just shrugged it off.
Worst part is is that I had bites on my feet, legs and arms yesterday but disregarded them as mosquitos maybe. Now my suspicions are confirmed, I am so pissed. I'm going to recommend a room change to start and if that doesn't work im going to demand our money back and we'll go somewhere else.
We also have a gig to play tonight. That will be fun when my skin feels like it's on fire :(
Anyway... just something I had to say

WRITING.TITLE: Metallica and Friends - Tuesday's Gone [Folk][Lynyrd Skynyrd cover]
Creative pigeon-holeing
WRITING.TEXT:
Alright guys. So i need some advice.
I've always played in punk and metal bands, and whilst that is one side of what I do and I love doing it. I also have a real melodic streak and love softer acoustic music.
I want to start heading down that path creatively but feel i have cornered myself into the harder genres to a point I don't want to expose this other side to people i know.
Does anyone else suffer this? I'd love some opinions or advice. Cheers.

WRITING.TITLE: Music Goers: Small to Medium Band Venues in these cities...
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi guys and girls!
My group is coming over to the United Kingdom from Australia and are looking to book small to medium venues in the below cities... We're looking at around 100 people capacity venues per each show as it's our first time coming over and don't want to overdo it.
So if you could help me out by suggesting some venues to contact in each of these cities, that would be awesome!
Cheers
-London
-Reading
-Bristol
-Cardiff
-Birmingham
-Liverpool
-Manchester
-Sheffield
-Leeds
-Newcastle
